item.title: The Future of the American Empire
item.description: Strange argues that increasingly power in the international political economy is not territorially defined, and what has emerged is an empire that is not territorially based, and secondly is controlled by information-rich US corporations. However while she call this the ‘American Empire’ her argument is (self-avowedly) close to an international Gramscian ‘historical bloc’ analysis. Thus the controlling bureaucracy of this empire while based on American values and culture is not necessarily staffed by Americans.
